oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Results of the Finnish selenium monitoring program 2000-2001
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eurola, Merja
Alfthan, Georg
Aro, Antti
Ekholm, Päivi
Hietaniemi, Veli
Rainio, Heikki
Rankanen, Riitta
Venäläinen, Eija-Riitta
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In Finland compound fertilizers have been supplemented with selenium (Se) since 1984. In 1998, the Finnish Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry raised the Se supplementation level in fertilizers from 6 to 10 mg Se/kg fertilizer. The most important sources of Se are milk, meat, and milk and meat products, which together cover nearly 70 % of the total Se intake.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Eurola, Merja; Alfthan, Georg; Aro, Antti; Ekholm, Päivi; Hietaniemi, Veli; Rainio, Heikki; Rankanen, Riitta and Venäläinen, Eija-Riitta (2003) Results of the Finnish selenium monitoring program 2000-2001. Agrifood Research Reports, no. 36. MTT Agrifood Research Finland.
